name: Demonstrate basic e-mail functions (NF:004) (PQ)
definition:
Demonstrate the ability to use fundamental e-mail features to communicate effectively in a business setting.  
- Compose and send emails  
- Attach files to messages  
- Use reply and forward functions

name: Demonstrate personal information management/productivity applications (NF:005) (PQ)
definition:
Demonstrate the ability to use personal information management and productivity applications to organize, plan, and complete tasks efficiently.  
- Create and organize files and emails  
- Use calendar and scheduling tools  
- Use word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software

name: Demonstrate basic web-search skills (NF:006) (PQ)
definition:
Demonstrate the ability to effectively use online search tools to find information.  
- Use relevant keywords and search operators  
- Evaluate the credibility of sources  
- Apply search techniques to locate specific information efficiently

name: Demonstrate basic word processing skills (NF:007) (PQ)
definition:
Shows the ability to use basic features of word processing software to create, edit, and format documents.  
- Formatting text (e.g., bold, italics, underline)  
- Inserting and editing images or objects  
- Saving and printing documents

name: Demonstrate basic presentation applications (NF:008) (PQ)
definition:
Demonstrate fundamental skills in presentation software by creating, formatting, and delivering business presentations.
   - Use presentation tools and features
   - Apply basic design principles
   - Prepare and deliver a presentation

name: Demonstrate basic database applications (NF:009) (PQ)
definition: Demonstrate the ability to use basic database applications to organize, store, and retrieve data efficiently; this includes skills such as creating, modifying, and querying databases.

name: Demonstrate basic spreadsheet applications (NF:010) (PQ)
definition:
Use spreadsheet software to perform basic data organization and analysis tasks. This includes:
- entering and editing data
- using formulas to calculate totals and averages
- creating simple charts and tables

name: Use an integrated business software application package (NF:088) (CS)
definition:
Using an integrated business software application package involves operating a software tool that combines multiple functions to manage business tasks efficiently.  
- May include functions such as accounting, inventory management, customer relationship management, and sales processing.  
- Enables users to perform various business activities within a single system.  
- Helps improve accuracy and productivity by streamlining processes.

name: Demonstrate collaborative/groupware applications (NF:011) (CS)
definition:
Use collaborative or groupware applications to communicate and work with others effectively. These may include:
- Email communication tools
- Shared documents and editing platforms
- Online project management software

name: Create and post basic web page (NF:042) (CS)
definition:
This performance indicator involves designing and publishing a simple webpage.  
   - Creating a basic layout using HTML  
   - Adding text, images, or links to the page  
   - Uploading the webpage to a web server or hosting platform

name: Collaborate on and aggregate complex internal documents to create a common voice (NF:215) (SP)
definition: Working together to compile and combine detailed internal documents to develop a unified message or voice among team members.

name: Describe the nature of business records (NF:001) (SP)
definition:
Business records are organized documents used to track and manage a company's financial and operational activities.  
- Financial statements  
- Sales records  
- Inventory logs

name: Maintain customer records (NF:002) (SP)
definition:
The process of systematically recording and organizing customer information to improve service and sales.  
   - Customer contact details  
   - Purchase history  
   - Preferences and feedback

name: Describe current business trends (NF:013) (SP)
definition:
An explanation of recent developments in the business world. This includes:
  - new technologies
  - market shifts
  - emerging industries

name: Monitor internal records for business information (NF:014) (SP)
definition:
The process of reviewing and analyzing internal business records to ensure accuracy and completeness.  
- Identify errors or discrepancies  
- Verify that records are up-to-date  
- Ensure data accuracy for decision-making

name: Conduct an environmental scan to obtain business information (NF:015) (SP)
definition:
Analyzing external and internal factors to gather relevant business information.  
- Identify market trends  
- Assess competitors  
- Evaluate customer needs and preferences

name: Interpret statistical findings (NF:093) (SP)
definition:
Understanding and explaining the results of statistical analysis, including what the data shows and what it implies.  
- Summarizing the main findings of statistical data  
- Explaining the significance of the data in decision-making  
- Using data to support conclusions or recommendations

name: Translate research findings into actionable business recommendations (NF:216) (SP)
definition:
Converting research results into practical suggestions for improving business strategies or making decisions.  
   - Identifying key insights from data  
   - Developing specific action plans  
   - Communicating recommendations effectively

name: Explain the principles of data analysis (NF:139) (SP)
definition:
The principles of data analysis involve understanding how to examine and interpret data to make informed business decisions. This includes:
- collecting relevant data
- organizing and summarizing data effectively
- identifying patterns, trends, and relationships within the data

name: Explain the nature of tools that can be used to access information in the database system (NF:140)
definition:
Tools used to access information in a database system are methods or software features that allow users to retrieve, view, and manage data efficiently. Examples include:
- Query languages (e.g., SQL)
- Search functions
- Filtering and sorting tools

name: Access information in the database system (NF:141) (SP)
definition: Understanding how to retrieve data stored in a database system by searching, querying, or filtering information efficiently.

name: Discuss the nature of data mining (NF:148) (CS)
definition:
Data mining involves analyzing large sets of data to discover useful patterns and information.  
- Identifies trends and relationships within data  
- Uses various techniques to extract valuable insights  
- Helps businesses make informed decisions

name: Describe data mining tools and techniques (NF:149) (SP)
definition:
Data mining tools and techniques are methods used to analyze large sets of data to discover patterns, trends, and useful information.  
- Techniques include classification, clustering, association rule learning, and regression.  
- Tools often involve software that helps organize, visualize, and interpret data effectively.

name: Discuss the importance of ethics in data mining (NF:150) (SP)
definition:
Understanding the importance of ethics in data mining involves recognizing how responsible practices protect individuals and maintain trust. This includes considering:
- Privacy of personal information
- Avoiding data misuse or manipulation
- Ensuring transparency in data collection and analysis

name: Demonstrate basic data mining techniques (NF:151) (SP)
definition:
The ability to apply fundamental data mining methods to analyze and extract useful information from large datasets.  
   - identifying patterns and trends  
   - using software tools for data analysis  
   - interpreting data findings

name: Interpret data mining findings (NF:152) (SP)
definition:
Analyzing the results of data mining to understand patterns and insights.  
- Identifying key trends and relationships in data  
- Summarizing findings to support business decisions  
- Explaining the significance of data patterns and anomalies

name: Explain the nature of operations (OP:189) (CS)
definition:
The nature of operations involves understanding the core functions and daily activities that a business conducts to produce goods or services.  
- Identifies key activities such as production, marketing, and customer service  
- Describes how these activities contribute to business goals  
- Explains how operations help fulfill customer needs and ensure business success

name: Discuss the role of ethics in operations (OP:190) (SP)
definition:
The importance of ethics in daily business operations and decision-making.  
- Upholding moral principles  
- Ensuring honesty and fairness  
- Maintaining trust with stakeholders

name: Describe the use of technology in operations (OP:191) (SP)
definition:
The application of technological tools to improve and support business operations, including:
- automation of tasks
- data management systems
- communication platforms

name: Describe health and safety regulations in business (OP:004) (PQ)
definition:
Policies and rules implemented by businesses to protect employees, customers, and property. These regulations include:
- OSHA workplace safety standards
- Emergency procedures
- Health requirements for food and health services

name: Report noncompliance with business health and safety regulations (OP:005) (PQ)
definition: A student should identify and communicate instances where a business is not following health and safety laws or regulations. This may include reporting violations such as failure to maintain a safe work environment, improper safety procedures, or unsafe equipment.

name: Follow instructions for use of equipment, tools, and machinery (OP:006) (PQ)
definition:
Understanding and following proper instructions ensures safe and effective operation of equipment, tools, and machinery.  
- Carefully read and understand the instructions before use  
- Follow safety guidelines and procedures  
- Use the equipment, tools, or machinery as intended and according to specifications

name: Follow safety precautions (OP:007) (PQ)
definition:
Adhere to safety procedures to prevent accidents and injuries.  
- Use personal protective equipment (PPE)  
- Follow workplace safety guidelines  
- Report hazards or unsafe conditions

name: Maintain a safe work environment (OP:008) (CS)
definition:
Ensuring a safe work environment involves following procedures and practices to prevent accidents and injuries.  
- Properly using equipment and tools  
- Following safety guidelines and procedures  
- Reporting hazards or unsafe conditions

name: Explain procedures for handling accidents (OP:009) (CS)
definition:
Describes the steps and actions to take when responding to accidents in a business or retail environment, ensuring safety and proper documentation.  
- Follow safety protocols  
- Report the incident to appropriate personnel  
- Assist with accident investigations

name: Handle and report emergency situations (OP:010) (CS)
definition: Respond promptly and effectively to emergency situations by taking appropriate actions and reporting the incident to the proper authorities. This includes recognizing emergencies, following safety procedures, and documenting the event accurately.

name: Explain routine security precautions (OP:013) (CS)
definition:
Describes the standard security measures used to protect business assets and information, including:
- Locking doors and windows
- Using passwords and access controls
- Maintaining confidentiality of sensitive information

name: Follow established security procedures/policies (OP:152) (CS)
definition:
Adhering to security procedures and policies involves consistently following approved steps and rules to protect information and resources.  
- Perform security checks before handling sensitive data  
- Report security breaches or suspicious activities  
- Use authorized methods for data access and sharing

name: Protect company information and intangibles (OP:153) (CS)
definition: Protecting company information and intangibles involves safeguarding sensitive data and valuable assets, such as trade secrets, proprietary information, and intellectual property, from unauthorized access, theft, or disclosure.

name: Explain information privacy, security, and confidentiality considerations in business (OP:441) (CS)
definition:
Understanding the importance of protecting sensitive information in business by considering aspects such as privacy, security, and confidentiality, including:
- safeguarding customer and employee data
- implementing security measures like passwords and encryption
- maintaining confidentiality to prevent unauthorized information sharing

name: Maintain data security (OP:064) (CS)
definition:
Protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access or breaches to ensure confidentiality and integrity.  
- Implement security measures  
- Monitor data access  
- Follow privacy policies

name: Explain the nature of project management (OP:158) (SP)
definition:
Project management involves planning, organizing, and overseeing resources to complete a specific project. Key elements include:
- defining project goals and objectives
- developing a timeline and budget
- coordinating team efforts and tasks

name: Describe the role of ethics in project management (OP:675) (SP)
definition:
The importance of maintaining honesty, fairness, and integrity in managing projects, including:
- Ensuring transparency in decision-making
- Adhering to organizational and industry standards
- Building trust with stakeholders

name: Plan project (OP:519) (CS)
definition: Develops a detailed approach for a specific project by establishing objectives, identifying resources, and outlining steps to ensure successful completion.

name: Monitor projects and take corrective actions (OP:520) (CS)
definition:
Regularly track the progress of projects and implement necessary adjustments to ensure objectives are met.  
- Identify any issues or deviations from the plan  
- Analyze data to determine areas needing improvement  
- Take corrective steps to keep the project on track

name: Evaluate project success (OP:521) (CS)
definition: Assess the outcomes of a project to determine if the goals and objectives were achieved. This includes reviewing results, analyzing data, and identifying areas for improvement.

name: Identify resources needed for project (OP:003) (SP)
definition:
Determining the materials, personnel, and financial requirements essential for successfully completing a project.  
- Staff needs  
- Equipment and supplies  
- Budget and funding sources

name: Develop project plan (OP:001) (SP)
definition:
A detailed outline of the steps and resources needed to complete a project.  
   - Setting goals and objectives  
   - Identifying necessary tasks and deadlines  
   - Determining required resources and personnel

name: Apply project-management tools to monitor and communicate project progress (OP:002) (SP)
definition:
Use project-management tools to track and share the progress of a project. This includes:
- Updating project timelines
- Sharing status reports
- Communicating changes or issues to stakeholders

name: Evaluate project results (OP:159) (SP)
definition:
Assess the outcomes of a project to determine its success and areas for improvement, including:
- Evaluating whether project objectives were met
- Analyzing data and results
- Identifying lessons learned for future projects

name: Explain the nature and scope of purchasing (OP:015) (CS)
definition:
The nature and scope of purchasing involve understanding the overall process of acquiring goods and services. This includes:
- Identifying needs
- Selecting suppliers
- Negotiating terms and prices

name: Place orders/reorders (OP:016) (CS)
definition:
The process of submitting requests to purchase additional inventory or supplies to ensure products are available for customers.  
   - Reviewing inventory levels  
   - Selecting products to reorder  
   - Submitting purchase requests

name: Maintain inventory of supplies (OP:031) (CS)
definition:
The process of regularly tracking and managing the quantities of supplies on hand to ensure adequacy and prevent shortages.  
- Checking inventory levels  
- Recording supply counts  
- Reordering supplies when needed

name: Discuss the importance of utilizing ethical purchasing methods (OP:246) (SP)
definition:
Understanding why using ethical purchasing methods is important helps ensure responsible business practices.  
- Promotes fair treatment of suppliers and workers  
- Protects the company's reputation and builds trust with consumers  
- Ensures products are sourced sustainably and ethically

name: Explain the impact of the purchasing process on productivity (OP:247) (SP)
definition:
The purchasing process affects productivity by influencing how efficiently a business acquires goods and services.  
- Ensures timely availability of needed resources  
- Affects overall operational efficiency  
- Impacts costs and quality of products or services

name: Manage the bid process in purchasing (OP:160) (SP)
definition: The process of overseeing and coordinating the steps involved in submitting and evaluating bids from suppliers to ensure the best value and compliance with purchasing policies.

name: Select vendors (OP:161) (SP)
definition:
The process of choosing suppliers or providers to meet the business's needs.  
   - Evaluating vendor options  
   - Comparing costs and quality  
   - Making a final selection based on criteria

name: Evaluate vendor performance (OP:162) (SP)
definition: Assess how well a vendor meets performance standards by reviewing factors such as delivery times, product quality, and service.

name: Explain the concept of production (OP:017) (CS)
definition:
Production is the process of creating goods and services to meet consumer needs.  
- involves transforming resources into finished products  
- includes activities like manufacturing, assembling, and packaging  
- aims to provide value and satisfy customer demand

name: Identify quality-control measures (OP:163) (SP)
definition:
A process used to ensure products or services meet specific standards of quality.  
- Establishing procedures to monitor and evaluate quality  
- Implementing testing or inspections  
- Using feedback to improve quality control measures

name: Utilize quality control methods at work (OP:164) (SP)
definition:
Applying procedures to monitor and maintain the quality of work to ensure products or services meet established standards.  
- Inspecting products or processes  
- Following quality guidelines  
- Correcting deficiencies to improve quality

name: Describe crucial elements of a quality culture (OP:019) (SP)
definition:
The essential components that contribute to a positive and effective organizational environment. These include:
- Strong ethical standards and integrity
- Open communication and collaboration
- Commitment to continuous improvement

name: Resolve problems with suppliers' quality issues (OP:652) (SP)
definition:
It involves identifying and addressing quality issues with suppliers to ensure products meet standards.  
- Communicating with suppliers about quality concerns  
- Analyzing defect patterns or quality reports  
- Implementing corrective actions to resolve issues

name: Explain the nature of overhead/operating costs (OP:024) (SP)
definition:
Overhead or operating costs are expenses necessary for running a business that are not directly linked to producing a specific product or service. These costs include:
- rent
- utilities
- salaries of administrative staff

name: Explain employee's role in expense control (OP:025) (SP)
definition:
Describes the responsibilities and actions an employee should take to help manage and reduce expenses in the workplace.  
- Recognize cost-saving opportunities  
- Follow budget guidelines  
- Use resources efficiently

name: Organize and prioritize work (OP:228) (CS)
definition:
This skill involves arranging tasks in order of importance and setting deadlines to ensure efficient completion.  
   - Identifying urgent and important tasks  
   - Assigning priorities to responsibilities  
   - Scheduling activities to meet deadlines

name: Coordinate work with that of team members (OP:230) (CS)
definition:
Working effectively with team members to complete tasks and achieve common goals by:
- Sharing responsibilities
- Communicating clearly
- Supporting others in the group

name: Coordinate activities with those of other departments (OP:196) (SP)
definition: Ensures efficient collaboration and communication by organizing and aligning activities with other departments to achieve common goals.

name: Monitor and ensure completion of delegated tasks (OP:354) (SP)
definition:
This performance indicator involves overseeing and confirming that assigned tasks are finished on time and according to standards.  
- Track progress of delegated tasks  
- Provide support or guidance as needed  
- Confirm completion of tasks efficiently

name: Streamline work processes (OP:355) (SP)
definition:
The process of improving and simplifying work procedures to increase efficiency, reduce redundancy, and save time.  
- Analyzing current workflows  
- Identifying areas for improvement  
- Implementing changes to enhance productivity

name: Comply with policies and procedures for use of property and equipment (OP:442) (CS)
definition:
Understanding and following the rules for using property and equipment ensures proper and responsible management.  
- Follow organizational policies and procedures related to property and equipment  
- Properly use, maintain, and care for property and equipment  
- Report any issues or damages promptly

name: Explain the concept of supply chain (OP:443) (CS)
definition:
A supply chain is the system of activities, organizations, and resources involved in producing and delivering a product or service from suppliers to customers. It includes:
- Sourcing raw materials
- Manufacturing or assembling products
- Distributing to retailers or consumers

name: Explain the benefits of supply chain collaboration (OP:444) (SP)
definition:
Collaboration in the supply chain involves working closely with suppliers, partners, and other stakeholders to improve efficiency and effectiveness.  
- It reduces costs through shared resources and information.  
- It enhances product quality and delivery speed.  
- It fosters innovation and stronger business relationships.

name: Maintain appropriate personal appearance (PD:002) (PQ)
definition:
The ability to present oneself professionally by dressing appropriately and maintaining good grooming standards. This includes:
- Wearing suitable attire for the setting
- Practicing good hygiene
- Maintaining neat and clean appearance

name: Demonstrate systematic behavior (PD:009) (PQ)
definition:
A systematic behavior involves consistently following organized and planned procedures to complete tasks efficiently. This includes:
- Applying established methods or processes
- Maintaining consistency in actions
- Following steps logically to ensure accuracy and effectiveness

name: Set personal goals (PD:018) (CS)
definition:
Establishing personal goals involves identifying specific, measurable objectives to improve skills or performance.  
- Identify areas for growth  
- Set achievable targets with deadlines  
- Create action steps to reach goals

name: Balance personal and professional responsibilities (PD:179) (SP)
definition:
Managing and organizing one’s personal and professional tasks effectively to ensure all responsibilities are met and priorities are balanced.  
   - Prioritizing activities  
   - Setting boundaries between work and personal life  
   - Managing time efficiently

name: Adhere to company protocols and policies (PD:250) (CS)
definition: Follow and comply with the company’s established rules and procedures to ensure consistent and ethical business operations.

name: Follow rules of conduct (PD:251) (CS)
definition:
Adhering to established standards of behavior in a professional setting, including:
- Acting honestly and ethically
- Respecting others and maintaining professionalism
- Following policies and procedures

name: Follow chain of command (PD:252) (CS)
definition:
Understanding and respecting the established hierarchy within an organization to ensure effective communication and decision-making.  
- Recognize the appropriate levels of authority  
- Communicate through the proper channels  
- Follow organizational procedures when reporting or seeking approval

name: Determine the nature of organizational goals (PD:254) (SP)
definition:
Understanding the purpose and characteristics of an organization's goals is essential. This includes:
- Recognizing the difference between short-term and long-term goals
- Identifying various types of goals, such as strategic, operational, or financial
- Analyzing how organizational goals guide decision-making and actions

name: Ascertain employee's role in meeting organizational goals (PD:255) (SP)
definition:
Understanding an employee's role in helping the organization achieve its goals involves recognizing how their specific tasks contribute to overall success.  

- Identifying the employee’s responsibilities relating to organizational objectives  
- Recognizing how individual efforts support team and company targets  
- Connecting daily tasks to broader organizational outcomes

name: Explain the need for innovation skills (PD:126) (CS)
definition:
Understanding the importance of innovation skills involves recognizing how they help businesses stay competitive and adapt to change. This includes knowing that innovation skills:
- Encourage creative problem-solving
- Support the development of new products and services
- Promote continuous improvement in business processes

name: Make decisions (PD:017) (CS)
definition:
The ability to evaluate options and choose the best course of action based on available information and objectives.  
- Analyzing information and options  
- Considering potential outcomes  
- Selecting the most appropriate decision

name: Demonstrate problem-solving skills (PD:077) (CS)
definition:
The ability to identify issues, analyze information, and develop effective solutions.  
- Recognize problems within a business context  
- Analyze relevant data and variables  
- Develop and evaluate potential solutions

name: Demonstrate appropriate creativity (PD:012) (SP)
definition:
Demonstrating appropriate creativity involves using original ideas and innovative thinking to develop effective solutions or presentations.  
- Generating unique ideas  
- Applying innovative approaches to problem-solving  
- Using creative techniques to enhance projects or presentations

name: Use time-management skills (PD:019) (SP)
definition:
Effectively organize and prioritize tasks to maximize productivity.  
- Set goals and deadlines  
- Create schedules or to-do lists  
- Avoid procrastination

name: Assess personal interests and skills needed for success in business (PD:013) (PQ)
definition:
The process of evaluating your individual interests and skills to determine how well they align with success in business careers.  
- Recognizing personal strengths and preferences  
- Identifying skills related to business tasks  
- Considering how interests influence career choices

name: Analyze employer expectations in the business environment (PD:020) (PQ)
definition: Understand what employers look for in employees within the business environment, including their expectations related to skills, work ethic, and professional behavior.

name: Explain the rights of workers (PD:021) (PQ)
definition:
The rights of workers are the legal and ethical entitlements that employees have in the workplace to ensure fair treatment and safety. These rights include:
- The right to a safe and healthy work environment
- The right to fair wages and equal pay
- The right to organize and join labor unions

name: Identify sources of career information (PD:022) (CS)
definition:
Sources of career information are resources where individuals can find details about possible careers. Examples include:
   - Career websites and online databases
   - Guidance counselors and career specialists
   - Industry publications and job fairs

name: Identify tentative occupational interest (PD:023) (CS)
definition:
Recognize possible career interests by exploring personal preferences and abilities.  
- Identify activities or fields that appeal to individual interests  
- Assess personal strengths related to potential careers  
- Consider how interests align with different occupational options

name: Explain employment opportunities in business (PD:025) (CS)
definition:
This indicator involves describing various employment opportunities available in the business industry, including different roles and career paths.  
- Entry-level positions  
- Management and leadership roles  
- Entrepreneurial opportunities

name: Explain career opportunities in entrepreneurship (PD:066) (CS)
definition: Describe the various career opportunities available in entrepreneurship, including roles such as business owner, startup founder, and franchise owner.

name: Utilize job-search strategies (PD:026) (PQ)
definition:
The process of actively seeking employment opportunities using effective methods.  
- Developing a resume and cover letter  
- Networking with potential employers  
- Using online job search tools and resources

name: Complete a job application (PD:027) (PQ)
definition:
This indicator involves filling out a job application form accurately and completely.  
- Providing personal information  
- Listing previous employment history  
- Indicating references and certifications

name: Interview for a job (PD:028) (PQ)
definition:
The process of preparing for and participating in a formal conversation with a potential employer to demonstrate qualifications and interest in a job.  
- Research the company and position  
- Dress professionally and arrive on time  
- Answer questions clearly and confidently

name: Write a follow-up letter after job interviews (PD:029) (CS)
definition:
A written message sent to express appreciation and reinforce interest after a job interview. Elements include:
- Thanking the interviewer for their time
- Reiterating enthusiasm for the position
- Highlighting qualifications or discussing next steps

name: Write a letter of application (PD:030) (CS)
definition:
A formal written request for a position or opportunity that includes key information such as personal details, qualifications, and reasons for interest.  
   - Addressed to the hiring manager or organization  
   - Includes a brief introduction and conclusion  
   - Highlights relevant skills, experience, and enthusiasm

name: Prepare a resume (PD:031) (CS)
definition:
A written document that summarizes an individual's education, skills, experience, and achievements to apply for jobs or internships.  
- Includes contact information, objective, education, work experience, skills, and references.  
- Should be clear, professional, and free of errors.  
- Tailored to the position or industry being targeted.

name: Use networking techniques to identify employment opportunities (PD:037) (SP)
definition:
The ability to apply various networking strategies to discover potential job openings and career opportunities.
- Establish and maintain professional contacts
- Attend industry events and job fairs
- Utilize social media and online platforms to connect with industry professionals

name: Describe techniques for obtaining work experience (e.g., volunteer activities, internships) (PD:032)
definition:
Methods used to gain practical work experience include activities such as:
- volunteering in community or school projects
- participating in internships related to the field
- engaging in part-time or summer jobs

name: Explain the need for ongoing education as a worker (PD:033) (PQ)
definition:
The importance of continuing education for workers to stay current and improve their skills.  
   - Keeps skills updated with industry changes  
   - Helps improve job performance  
   - Enhances career growth opportunities

name: Explain possible advancement patterns for jobs (PD:034) (PQ)
definition:
Describes different paths for career growth within a job or industry, including opportunities for promotion and skill development.  
   - Vertical advancement (e.g., supervisor, manager)  
   - Lateral movement (e.g., changing roles at the same level)  
   - Specialization or skill enhancement (e.g., certification or training)

name: Identify skills needed to enhance career progression (PD:035) (SP)
definition:
Recognize the abilities necessary to advance in a career.  
  - Effective communication skills  
  - Leadership and teamwork abilities  
  - Time management and problem-solving skills

name: professional/trade associations, classes/seminars, trade shows, and mentors) (PD:036) (SP)
definition:
Organizations, events, and resources that provide professional development and networking opportunities. Examples include:
- professional/trade associations  
- classes and seminars  
- trade shows  
- mentors

name: Explain the concept of management (SM:001) (CS)
definition: Management is the process of coordinating and overseeing an organization’s resources, activities, and staff to achieve specific goals. It involves planning, organizing, leading, and controlling operations to ensure effectiveness and efficiency.

name: Explain factors that affect management (SM:100) (SP)
definition:
Factors that affect management are the internal and external elements that influence a manager’s ability to plan, organize, lead, and control an organization. These include:
- Organizational structure and culture
- Economic conditions
- Technology and innovation

name: Explain the nature of risk management (SM:075) (SP)
definition:
The process of identifying, assessing, and controlling potential risks to minimize their impact on a business.  
- Identifying possible risks that could affect the business  
- Analyzing the likelihood and potential impact of these risks  
- Implementing strategies to reduce or manage the risks

name: Conduct a risk assessment of an event (SM:076) (SP)
definition:
Evaluating potential hazards and uncertainties associated with an event to determine levels of risk.  
- Identifying possible risks
- Analyzing the likelihood of risks occurring
- Assessing the potential impact on the event

name: Describe factors affecting the settlement of legal matters (BL:159) (SP)
definition:
Factors affecting the settlement of legal matters include conditions and considerations that influence how disputes are resolved. These can include:
- the terms of the legal agreement
- the willingness of parties to negotiate
- applicable laws and regulations

name: Describe the litigation process (BL:160) (SP)
definition:
The process of resolving disputes through legal procedures in court. This includes:
- Filing a complaint
- Pre-trial procedures
- Trial proceedings
- Verdict and potential appeals

name: Discuss the arbitration/mediation process (BL:161) (SP)
definition:
The process of resolving disputes between parties without going to court by using a neutral third party.  
- Arbitration: a binding decision made by the neutral third party  
- Mediation: a non-binding process where the third party helps parties reach a mutual agreement  
- Steps involved in each process, including negotiation and reaching a resolution

name: (CO:185) (SP)
definition:
This indicator focuses on demonstrating an understanding of how to effectively communicate and collaborate with others in a professional setting.  
- Recognize the importance of teamwork and communication skills in business  
- Practice active listening and clear verbal or written expression  
- Apply interpersonal skills to build positive professional relationships

name: Write research reports (CO:186) (SP)
definition:
This involves creating written documents that analyze a business problem or opportunity.  
- Includes identifying the purpose of the report  
- Collecting and organizing relevant data  
- Presenting findings and recommendations clearly

name: Interpret cash-flow statements (FI:541) (SP)
definition:
Understanding cash-flow statements involves analyzing a financial report that shows how cash moves in and out of a business over a specific period. This includes:

- Identifying cash inflows, such as sales revenue and loans
- Recognizing cash outflows, like expenses and investments
- Interpreting how the cash position affects business operations and financial health

name: Utilize project-management software (NF:130) (SP)
definition:
Using project-management software involves applying digital tools to plan, organize, and monitor projects efficiently.  
   - Creating project timelines and schedules  
   - Assigning tasks to team members  
   - Tracking project progress and deadlines

name: Adhere to data change best practices (NF:264) (SP)
definition:
Following recognized best practices when updating and managing data to ensure accuracy, security, and consistency.  
- Review data change procedures  
- Maintain data integrity during updates  
- Document data modifications

name: Discuss legal considerations in operations (OP:339) (SP)
definition:
This involves explaining the legal factors that impact business operations.  
- Understanding laws and regulations affecting business activities  
- Recognizing the importance of compliance to avoid legal issues  
- Considering legal consequences of operational decisions

name: etc.) (OP:517) (SP)
definition:
This indicator involves understanding various elements or components related to a specific topic or activity, often listed or categorized for clarity.  
- Examples include:  
   - different types of customer service strategies  
   - various promotional methods  
   - key elements of a business plan

name: customers' credit-card numbers, passwords, customer transactions) (OP:518) (SP)
definition:
Protecting sensitive customer information, such as:
- credit-card numbers
- passwords
- customer transactions

name: Describe types of purchase orders (OP:250) (CS)
definition:
A description of the different forms of purchase orders used in business.  
- Standard purchase order  
- Blanket purchase order  
- Contract purchase order

name: Discuss types of inventory (OP:336) (CS)
definition:
The ability to explain different categories of inventory a business may hold.  
- Raw materials  
- Work-in-progress items  
- Finished goods

name: Discuss the nature of business analysis (OP:327) (SP)
definition:
A discussion of the nature of business analysis involves explaining what business analysis is and its purpose.  
- Understanding business analysis as the process of identifying business needs  
- Examining how it helps in improving processes, products, or services  
- Recognizing its role in making informed business decisions

name: Discuss business process thinking and its impact (OP:474) (SP)
definition: The ability to understand and explain how focusing on business processes can improve efficiency and effectiveness in an organization. This includes recognizing how process thinking impacts overall performance and outcomes.

name: Describe the factors that influence business process design (OP:475) (SP)
definition:
The factors that influence business process design are elements that impact how a business organizes and performs its tasks. These include:
- Business goals and objectives
- Technology and tools available
- Customer needs and expectations
- Regulatory requirements
- Cost and efficiency considerations

name: Explain the causes of business process changes (OP:476) (SP)
definition:
Understanding why business processes change involves identifying the factors that lead to modifications in how a business operates. These causes can include:
- External market shifts or economic trends
- Advancements in technology
- Changes in customer preferences or demands

name: Explain the impact of supply chain on business performance (OP:477) (SP)
definition:
The effect that the management of the production and distribution of goods and services has on a business’s success.  
- Efficient supply chains can reduce costs and improve customer satisfaction  
- Disruptions in supply chains can lead to delays and lost revenue  
- Effective supply chain management can give a competitive advantage

name: Describe supply chain networks (OP:479) (SP)
definition:
A system of interconnected businesses and activities involved in producing and delivering a product or service from the supplier to the customer.  
  - Includes suppliers, manufacturers, warehouses, distribution centers, retailers, and transportation methods  
  - Demonstrates how products move through the chain to reach consumers  
  - Helps understand how supply chain efficiency impacts business success

name: Discuss global supply chain issues (OP:480) (SP)
definition:
Analyzing current challenges affecting the movement of goods and services around the world.  
- Disruptions caused by natural disasters, political conflicts, or pandemics  
- Effects of transportation delays and port congestion  
- Impact of trade policies and international regulations

name: Discuss the nature of supply chain management (OP:303) (SP)
definition:
The process of overseeing and coordinating all activities involved in sourcing, procurement, production, and delivery of products or services to ensure efficiency and customer satisfaction.  
  - Managing inventory and logistics  
  - Coordinating suppliers and partners  
  - Ensuring timely delivery of products

name: Discuss ethical considerations in supply chain management (OP:677) (SP)
definition:
Consider the ethical issues involved in managing the supply chain, including principles like fairness, honesty, and responsibility.  
- Ensuring fair treatment of suppliers and workers  
- Avoiding deceptive or misleading practices  
- Maintaining transparency and sustainability in sourcing

name: Describe the impact of technology on supply chain management (OP:478) (SP)
definition:
The effect technology has on coordinating and managing the flow of goods, services, and information within a supply chain. This includes:

- Enhancing communication between supply chain partners  
- Improving inventory management and tracking  
- Increasing efficiency and reducing costs through automation

name: Maintain vendor/supplier relationships (OP:241) (SP)
definition:
Building and sustaining positive relationships with vendors or suppliers to ensure reliable product or service delivery.  
- Communicating effectively with vendors  
- Negotiating terms and agreements  
- Addressing issues or concerns promptly

name: Negotiate terms with vendors in business (OP:337) (SP)
definition:
The process of discussing and reaching an agreement on the terms of a business transaction with vendors, ensuring that the needs of both parties are met.  
- Items to consider include price, delivery schedules, and payment terms.

name: Discuss employment opportunities in business management and administration (PD:297) (CS)
definition:
Explains the various job roles and positions available in the field of business management and administration. This includes identifying different employment opportunities such as:
- managerial positions
- administrative roles
- support staff jobs

name: Discuss the nature of managerial planning (SM:063) (SP)
definition:
The process of identifying goals and determining the best actions to achieve them.  
- Establishing organizational objectives  
- Developing strategies to meet goals  
- Setting specific action plans

name: Explain managerial considerations in organizing (SM:064) (SP)
definition:
Considerations managers evaluate when organizing to ensure efficient and effective operations. This includes analyzing factors such as:
- available resources
- organizational structure
- workflow processes

name: Describe managerial considerations in staffing (SM:065) (SP)
definition:
Considerations managers evaluate when hiring and assigning staff, including:
- employee skills and qualifications
- workload and staffing needs
- organization policies and budget constraints

name: Discuss managerial considerations in directing (SM:066) (SP)
definition: Discuss the factors a manager considers when guiding and supervising employees to ensure work is completed effectively. These considerations include setting clear expectations, providing guidance and support, and motivating team members.

name: (SM:004) (SP)
definition:
This indicator involves understanding the importance of social media in business.  
- Recognizing how social media enhances brand awareness  
- Identifying strategies for effective social media marketing  
- Understanding the impact of social media analytics on business decisions

name: Describe relationship among innovation, learning, and change (SM:094) (CS)
definition:
This indicator explains how innovation, learning, and change are connected in a business environment.  
- Innovation involves creating new ideas or methods.  
- Learning is gaining knowledge or skills to improve.  
- Change is the process of adjusting or transforming business practices or strategies.

name: Explain the nature of change management (SM:095) (SP)
definition: Change management involves understanding how organizations prepare for, implement, and adapt to significant changes. This includes recognizing the reasons for change, the processes involved, and the impact on employees and operations.

name: Explain the change-management lifecycle (SM:096) (SP)
definition:
The change-management lifecycle involves the steps an organization follows to implement and adapt to change effectively. It includes:
- Planning for change
- Managing resistance and communication
- Evaluating and sustaining the change

name: Explain the nature of knowledge management (KM:001) (SP)
definition:
Knowledge management is the process of capturing, distributing, and effectively using an organization’s information and expertise. This includes:
- Collecting data and insights
- Sharing knowledge among team members
- Using information to improve decision-making and performance

name: Discuss the role of ethics in knowledge management (KM:002) (SP)
definition: The importance of ethics in knowledge management involves understanding how moral principles guide the proper handling, sharing, and protection of organizational information to ensure honesty, confidentiality, and responsible use.

name: Explain the use of technology in knowledge management (KM:003) (SP)
definition:
Technology in knowledge management involves using digital tools and systems to collect, organize, store, and share information within an organization. This includes:

- Computer software and databases
- Intranets and cloud storage
- Collaboration platforms and communication tools

name: Explain legal considerations for knowledge management (KM:004) (SP)
definition:
Understanding legal considerations for knowledge management involves recognizing the laws and regulations that affect how organizations collect, store, and share information.  
   - Protecting confidential and proprietary information  
   - Complying with data privacy laws and regulations  
   - Ensuring proper authorization and access controls

name: (KM:005) (SP)
definition:
This indicator involves understanding the concept of sustainable practices in business, including:

- Reducing environmental impact
- Utilizing renewable resources
- Implementing eco-friendly strategies

name: Apply knowledge management processes (KM:018) (SP)
definition:
Utilize processes to organize, store, and share knowledge within an organization to improve efficiency and decision-making.  
   - Identify knowledge assets  
   - Implement knowledge sharing methods  
   - Maintain knowledge management systems

name: Initiate project (PJ:005) (SP)
definition:
Beginning a project involves taking the initial steps to start planning and executing a business-related activity. This includes:
- Identifying the project goal
- Gathering necessary resources
- Developing a basic action plan

name: Prepare work breakdown structure (WBS) (PJ:006) (SP)
definition:
A work breakdown structure (WBS) is a visual tool that organizes and divides a project into smaller, manageable parts.  
   - Identifies project tasks and sub-tasks  
   - Helps in planning and scheduling work  
   - Ensures all project components are included

name: Execute and control projects (PJ:009) (SP)
definition:
Implement and monitor projects to ensure they are completed successfully.  
- Set performance standards and benchmarks  
- Track progress and make adjustments as needed  
- Use tools like timelines and budgets to control project activities

name: Manage project team (PJ:007) (SP)
definition:
Leading and organizing a project team to ensure tasks are completed effectively.  
- Assigning roles and responsibilities  
- Motivating team members  
- Monitoring progress and providing support

name: Manage project schedule (PJ:010) (SP)
definition:
The process of planning, organizing, and controlling project timelines to ensure timely completion.  
- Developing a project schedule  
- Monitoring progress against deadlines  
- Adjusting timelines as needed to stay on track

name: Close project (PJ:008) (SP)
definition:
Completing all necessary tasks to finalize a project, ensuring all objectives are met and deliverables are accepted.  
- Obtain approval of the project deliverables  
- Complete any remaining tasks or documentation  
- Communicate project closure to stakeholders

name: Explain the nature of quality management (QM:001) (SP)
definition:
Quality management involves the activities and processes used to ensure that a product or service meets consistent standards of quality. It includes:
   - setting quality objectives
   - implementing quality control measures
   - continuously improving processes to satisfy customer expectations

name: Describe the nature of quality management frameworks (e.g., Six Sigma, ITIL, CMMI) (QM:002) (SP)
definition:
A system used by organizations to improve and maintain the quality of their products and services. It includes structured frameworks such as:
- Six Sigma, which focuses on reducing errors
- ITIL, which manages IT services
- CMMI, which improves process maturity

name: Discuss the need for continuous improvement of the quality process (QM:003) (SP)
definition: The need for ongoing enhancement of the quality process involves recognizing that quality standards and procedures should be regularly reviewed and improved to increase efficiency, meet customer expectations, and maintain competitiveness.

name: Discuss ethical considerations in quality management (QM:012) (SP)
definition:
Consider the ethical issues involved in quality management practices.  
- Ensuring honesty in reporting quality data  
- Maintaining transparency in quality processes  
- Respecting customer and employee confidentiality

name: Explain the role of ethics in risk management (RM:041) (SP)
definition:
The importance of ethics in risk management involves guiding decision-making to ensure honesty and integrity.  
- Promoting fair treatment of stakeholders  
- Ensuring compliance with laws and regulations  
- Preventing dishonesty or misconduct in risk assessment and solutions

name: Describe the use of technology in risk management (RM:042) (SP)
definition:
The use of technology in risk management involves applying digital tools and software to identify, assess, and monitor potential business risks.  
- Analyzing data with software to predict and prevent risks  
- Using online systems for tracking and reporting issues  
- Implementing technology solutions to reduce or control risks

name: Discuss legal considerations affecting risk management (RM:043) (SP)
definition:
This involves explaining the legal factors that impact risk management decisions.  
- understanding laws and regulations that relate to risk  
- identifying legal obligations and liabilities  
- applying legal principles to develop risk management strategies

name: Describe international considerations affecting risk management (RM:092) (SP)
definition: Understanding how international factors influence risk management decisions, including considerations such as legal regulations, cultural differences, and economic conditions that vary across countries.

name: Greet and direct visitors (CO:181) (CS)
definition:
The ability to welcome visitors professionally and guide them to the appropriate person or location within a business setting.  
   - Greet visitors with a friendly attitude  
   - Provide clear directions or information  
   - Assist visitors in finding the desired department or individual

name: Take and relay messages (CO:182) (CS)
definition:
This involves receiving messages from others and accurately passing that information to the appropriate person or group.  
- Listening carefully to the message  
- Understanding the content of the message  
- Communicating the message clearly and promptly

name: Field telephone calls (CO:183) (CS)
definition:
The process of handling incoming and outgoing telephone calls in a professional manner.  
- Answering calls politely and promptly  
- Providing information or transferring calls as needed  
- Recording messages accurately

name: Arrange call-backs (CO:191) (CS)
definition:
The process of scheduling or coordinating follow-up contact with a customer or client after an initial interaction to ensure continued engagement, address additional needs, or close a sale.  
   - Calling back at an agreed-upon time  
   - Confirming previous discussions  
   - Providing additional information or updates

name: Screen telephone calls (CO:184) (CS)
definition:
The process of managing incoming phone calls to determine their importance and whether to answer, redirect, or take a message.  
- Prioritizing calls based on urgency  
- Identifying the caller's purpose  
- Deciding on appropriate response actions

name: Adapt to communications styles (written, verbal, formal/informal) (CO:192) (CS)
definition:
Adjust communication methods to match different styles and settings, such as written or verbal, formal or informal.  
- Recognize the appropriate style for the audience and situation  
- Use clear and suitable language for each communication style  
- Modify tone and delivery based on whether the context is formal or informal

name: Exercise confidentiality (EI:076) (CS)
definition:
Maintaining the privacy of sensitive information to build trust and uphold professional integrity.  
- Protecting customer and company information  
- Not sharing confidential data with unauthorized individuals  
- Following company policies on information security

name: Act as the office “gatekeeper” (EI:094) (CS)
definition: Controls access to the office or business area by monitoring visitors, phone calls, and deliveries to ensure proper procedures are followed.

name: Initiate and facilitate social interactions in a business environment (EI:096) (SP)
definition:
A skill that involves starting and helping to carry out social interactions in a business setting.  
   - Greeting clients or colleagues  
   - Engaging in small talk to build rapport  
   - Facilitating teamwork or group discussions

name: Handle the social and protocol aspects of business (EI:097) (SP)
definition:
Managing the social and protocol aspects of business involves understanding and applying appropriate manners, customs, and formalities to promote professional relationships. This includes:
- Demonstrating proper etiquette and respect in business interactions
- Following organizational protocols and cultural norms
- Communicating professionally to build positive relationships

name: Maintain contact with key clients/customers (EI:098) (SP)
definition:
Keeping in touch with important clients or customers regularly to build strong relationships and ensure their needs are met.  
   - Sending updates or follow-ups  
   - Responding promptly to inquiries  
   - Maintaining ongoing communication

name: Entertain customers at the office (EI:099) (SP)
definition:
Engaging customers in a pleasant and entertaining manner within the office environment to create a positive experience.  
- Use of friendly conversation  
- Providing light entertainment or activities  
- Creating a welcoming atmosphere

name: Act as the liaison between departments (EI:100) (SP)
definition:
Serve as the communication link between different departments to ensure coordination and information sharing.  
   - Facilitate the flow of information between departments  
   - Coordinate activities and initiatives  
   - Resolve interdepartmental issues

name: Track expenses (FI:604) (SP)
definition:
Monitoring and recording financial outlays to ensure proper management of funds.  
- Recording expenses in financial records  
- Categorizing expenses by type  
- Reviewing expenses to stay within the budget

name: clearing, etc.) (FI:113) (CS)
definition:
The process of removing or reducing existing product or service features, functions, or components.  
- Includes activities like clearing, editing, or simplifying offerings  
- Aims to improve clarity, reduce costs, or better meet customer needs

name: Maintain petty-cash fund (FI:310) (SP)
definition:
Managing a petty-cash fund involves overseeing a small amount of cash for minor business expenses.  
- Ensuring the fund has an adequate balance  
- Documenting all petty-cash transactions  
- Replenishing the fund as needed

name: Arrange advance travel cash (FI:603) (SP)
definition:
Arranging advance travel cash involves preparing and securing funds needed for travel expenses before the trip.  
- Ensuring sufficient cash is available for transportation, lodging, and meals  
- Coordinating with financial institutions or travel departments to obtain the funds  
- Documenting and processing the advance payment for travel needs

name: Manage purchasing cards (FI:778) (SP)
definition:
The process of overseeing the use of purchasing cards to ensure proper spending and compliance.  
- Monitoring transactions  
- Reconciling statements  
- Ensuring policies are followed

name: Describe information that can be obtained from annual reports (FI:277) (SP)
definition:
Information from annual reports includes key financial and operational details about a company. elements include:
- Financial statements (e.g., income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement)
- Management's discussion and analysis
- Notes to the financial statements

name: Prepare expense report tools (NF:197) (SP)
definition:
A process that involves creating and organizing tools used to track and document business expenses. This includes:
- Identifying appropriate expense report formats  
- Using software or templates to prepare reports  
- Ensuring accuracy and completeness in expense documentation

name: Demonstrate advanced web-search skills (NF:121) (SP)
definition:
The ability to effectively use advanced web-search techniques to find accurate and relevant information.  
- Utilize multiple search engines and specialized databases  
- Apply advanced search operators and filters  
- Evaluate sources for credibility and relevance

name: Demonstrate advanced word-processing skills (NF:122) (SP)
definition:
Demonstrating advanced word-processing skills involves efficiently using software to create, format, and edit documents with a high level of proficiency.
- Applying complex formatting options
- Using advanced features such as mail merge or tables
- Ensuring document accuracy and professionalism

name: Demonstrate advanced presentation applications (NF:123) (SP)
definition:
Demonstrate the ability to use advanced presentation software features to create effective presentations, including:
- incorporating multimedia elements
- applying custom animations and transitions
- designing professional slide layouts

name: Demonstrate advanced database applications (NF:124) (SP)
definition:
This indicator involves applying complex database skills to support business needs.  
- Designing and creating advanced database systems  
- Using query languages like SQL to retrieve and manipulate data  
- Implementing database management tools to ensure data integrity and security

name: Mine databases for information (NF:125) (SP)
definition:
The process of searching and retrieving relevant data from a database to support business decisions or activities. This includes:
- Using search tools or queries
- Filtering information to find specific data
- Organizing data for analysis

name: Demonstrate advanced spreadsheet applications (NF:126) (SP)
definition:
Demonstrate advanced skills in using spreadsheet software to organize, analyze, and present data.  
- Create complex formulas and functions  
- Use pivot tables and data analysis tools  
- Develop and format charts and reports

name: Create a web page for business applications (NF:127) (SP)
definition:
Design a web page for business applications that includes features such as:
- user-friendly navigation
- relevant content and visuals
- functional links or forms

name: Manage website's content (NF:198) (SP)
definition:
Organize and update a website’s content to ensure it is accurate, user-friendly, and aligned with business goals.  
- review existing content  
- add new content  
- remove outdated information

name: Prepare for cyber- and video-conferencing (NF:199) (SP)
definition:
This performance indicator involves getting ready to participate in online meetings or video calls.  
- Set up necessary equipment (computer, camera, microphone)  
- Test internet connection for stability  
- Prepare meeting materials or notes

name: Capture text using OCR (optical character reader) software (NF:128) (SP)
definition: Use OCR (optical character recognition) software to convert printed or handwritten text into editable digital text, enabling efficient data entry and document processing.

name: Use voice recognition technology to prepare documents (NF:129) (SP)
definition:
The process of using voice recognition technology to create written documents, enabling efficient and accurate transcription of spoken words.  
   - Converting spoken language into text  
   - Using software or devices with voice recognition features  
   - Preparing reports, memos, or other business documents

name: Utilize imaging software (NF:131) (SP)
definition:
Use imaging software to create, edit, or enhance visual images for marketing, advertising, or design purposes.  
   - Adjust colors and contrast  
   - Add text or graphics  
   - Edit images for clarity and appeal

name: Use accounting software (NF:200) (SP)
definition:
Using accounting software involves entering, managing, and analyzing financial data with digital tools to improve accuracy and efficiency.  
- Recording transactions  
- Generating financial reports  
- Managing accounts

name: Create calendar/schedule (NF:164) (CS)
definition:
A plan that outlines the specific dates and times for completing tasks or activities.  
- Identifies key deadlines  
- Includes important events or appointments  
- Organizes work in a logical sequence

name: Maintain appointment calendar (NF:165) (CS)
definition:
Organize and manage a schedule of appointments to ensure timely and efficient business operations.  
- Schedule appointments  
- Track upcoming meetings  
- Adjust appointments as needed

name: Verify appointments (NF:166) (CS)
definition:
Confirm that scheduled meetings or appointments are accurate and ready to proceed.  
- Verify the date, time, and location  
- Confirm the appointments with the involved parties  
- Ensure all necessary documents or materials are prepared

name: Schedule appointments (NF:188) (SP)
definition:
Arranging a specific date and time for meetings with clients, prospects, or team members to ensure effective communication.

- Identify areas for improvement

name: Recommend improvements to business processes (OP:462) (SP)
definition: Suggest ways to enhance or make business processes more efficient and effective. This includes analyzing current procedures and proposing changes to improve performance, productivity, or quality.

name: Explain the purpose of operational controls (OP:463) (SP)
definition:
Operational controls are measures implemented to ensure that business processes run efficiently and safely.  
- They help prevent errors and fraud  
- They ensure compliance with laws and policies  
- They improve overall business performance

name: Explain professional responsibilities in business information management (PD:180) (SP)
definition:
Understanding the duties and ethical standards expected of professionals in business information management.  
- Adhere to industry regulations and company policies  
- Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information  
- Demonstrate professionalism in communication and conduct

name: Discuss the role and responsibilities of project managers (PD:181) (SP)
definition:
The role and responsibilities of project managers involve overseeing and coordinating projects to ensure they are completed successfully. This includes:
- Planning project objectives and tasks
- Managing team members and resources
- Monitoring progress and addressing issues that arise

name: Describe the role and responsibilities of business analysts (PD:182) (SP)
definition:
Business analysts evaluate an organization's needs and recommend solutions to improve processes and achieve business goals. They are responsible for:
- Gathering and analyzing data to identify problems and opportunities
- Developing detailed requirements for projects and solutions
- Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of changes

name: Explain career opportunities in business information management (PD:185) (SP)
definition: Identify and describe various career opportunities available in the field of business information management, including roles such as data analyst, business analyst, systems administrator, and IT consultant.

name: Describe certifications in business information management (PD:186) (SP)
definition:
Certifications in business information management are formal credentials earned to demonstrate knowledge and skills in managing business data and information systems.  
   - Examples include certifications like Microsoft Office Specialist, CompTIA ITF+ (Information Technology Fundamentals), and Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT).

name: management skills (PD:343) (SP)
definition:
The ability to effectively plan, organize, lead, and control resources to achieve business goals.  
- Communicating clearly  
- Delegating tasks  
- Making decisions based on data

name: Identify professional association opportunities in business information management (PD:344) (SP)
definition:
Recognize opportunities to join professional associations related to business information management, which help develop industry connections and enhance career skills.  
   - Attend industry events  
   - Network with professionals  
   - Participate in association activities

name: organization (SM:037) (SP)
definition:
The process of arranging resources and activities to achieve business goals, including:
- Identifying the purpose and goals
- Developing a structure or framework
- Coordinating tasks and responsibilities

name: as a strategic asset (SM:079) (SP)
definition:
A valuable resource that contributes to achieving business goals by providing competitive advantages. Examples include:
- Brand reputation
- Intellectual property
- Customer loyalty

name: Establish uniform definitions of data (KM:010) (SP)
definition:
Establishing uniform definitions of data involves creating consistent and standardized meanings for data elements used within a business or organization. This ensures clear communication and accurate analysis.

   - Using consistent language across reports

name: Create a reference tool (data dictionary) (KM:011) (SP)
definition:
A reference tool that provides detailed descriptions of data elements used within a system or project.

name: Explain enterprise search design principles (KM:012) (SP)
definition:
This involves describing the fundamental guidelines for creating effective enterprise search systems that help users quickly find information within an organization.  
- Focuses on designing search features that improve efficiency and user experience  
- Includes considerations like search functionality, user interface, and access controls  
- Aims to support organizational knowledge management and decision-making

name: Analyze content management structures (e.g., taxonomies, metadata, retention) (KM:013) (SP)
definition:
Analyzing content management structures involves examining how information is organized and stored within a system.  
- Taxonomies (classification systems)  
- Metadata (descriptive data about content)  
- Retention policies (rules for how long to keep information)

name: Maintain knowledge management systems (KM:015) (SP)
definition:
A process that involves organizing, updating, and using knowledge management systems to improve efficiency and information sharing within an organization.  
   - Ensuring the system is current and accurate  
   - Monitoring system performance and usability  
   - Supporting users in accessing and utilizing the system effectively

name: Update knowledge management systems (KM:016) (SP)
definition: Regularly revise and improve knowledge management systems to ensure accurate, current, and accessible information within an organization.

name: Discuss the implications of quality costs (QM:010) (SP)
definition:
Analyzing how different types of quality costs affect a business.  
   - Prevention costs
   - Appraisal costs
   - Failure costs

name: Test product/service for quality (QM:004) (SP)
definition:
Evaluate a product or service to ensure it meets quality standards.  
- Check for defects or issues  
- Verify features and functions  
- Ensure consistency and reliability

name: Discuss the nature of enterprise risk management (ERM) (RM:062) (SP)
definition:
A discussion of enterprise risk management (ERM) involves explaining its purpose and key aspects.  
- Identifying potential risks that could impact an organization  
- Implementing strategies to manage and mitigate those risks  
- Understanding how ERM integrates with overall business objectives

name: Discuss the nature of contract suspensions (BL:084) (SP)
definition:
A discussion about the nature of contract suspensions explains when and why contracts are temporarily paused or put on hold. This includes understanding:

name: Explain the nature of contract terminations (BL:085) (SP)

- Procedures for ending a contract correctly

name: Explain regulations restricting customer trade (e.g., OFAC, FCPA, anti-bribery) (BL:156) (SP)
definition:
An explanation of laws and rules that limit or control how businesses and customers can trade or do business internationally. These regulations include:
- OFAC (Office of Foreign Assets Control)
- FCPA (Foreign Corrupt Practices Act)

name: Comply with export licensing regulations (BL:127) (SP)
definition: Follow all laws and rules related to exporting goods, including obtaining necessary licenses and permits.

name: Obtain releases and clearances to export products (BL:128) (SP)
definition:
The process of securing official permissions needed to legally send products out of the country.  
- Obtaining export licenses  
- Securing customs clearances  
- Receiving other required governmental approvals

name: Explain the nature of a compliance program (BL:162) (SP)
definition:
A compliance program is a structured process a company uses to ensure it follows laws, regulations, and ethical standards.  
- Establishes policies and procedures  
- Provides employee training and communication  
- Monitors and audits ongoing compliance

name: Repurpose content for social media (CO:210) (SP)

- Modifying images, videos, or text  
- Tailoring content for different platforms

name: Explain the nature of communications plans (CO:195) (SP)
definition:
A communication plan outlines how a business will share information to achieve its goals.  
- Identifies target audiences  
- Specifies communication methods and channels  
- Outlines steps for implementing and evaluating communication efforts

name: Implement a communications plan (CO:196) (SP)
definition:
Developing and executing a strategy to share information effectively.

- Selecting appropriate communication channels  
- Monitoring and adjusting the message as needed

name: Monitor communications plan (CO:197) (SP)
definition: Regularly review and track the progress of the communications plan to ensure it is effectively reaching the target audience and meeting its objectives.

name: Develop communications plan (CO:198) (SP)
definition:

- Setting communication objectives

- Choosing appropriate methods and tools for communication

name: Adjust communications plan (CO:199) (SP)

Making changes to a communications plan to improve clarity, effectiveness, or alignment with current goals.  
- Revising message content  
- Updating communication channels  
- Changing target audiences

name: Explain the impact of business customs and practices on global trade (EI:082) (SP)
definition:

- Traditional business practices and etiquette followed in different countries

name: Describe the nature of business customs and practices in the North American market (EI:083) (SP)

name: Explain the nature of business customs and practices in South Asia (EI:118) (SP)

name: Describe the nature of business customs and practices in Northern Africa (EI:119) (SP)

name: Discuss the nature of business customs and practices in Sub-Saharan Africa (EI:120) (SP)

definition: Managerial accounting involves the process of preparing and analyzing financial information for internal use by managers to make informed business decisions. This includes understanding cost behaviors, budgeting, and financial planning to help improve business operations.

definition:
Variance analysis involves comparing actual financial performance to budgeted or standard amounts to identify differences. It helps managers understand why variances occur and make better decisions.  
- Identify differences between planned and actual results  
- Analyze causes of variances  
- Use findings to improve financial planning and control

name: Explain labor-relations issues (HR:452) (SP)
definition:
Understanding labor-relations issues involves explaining the challenges and conflicts between employers and employees.

name: (HR:515) (SP)
definition:

   - Identifying staffing requirements

definition:
The nature of facilities management involves overseeing and maintaining a business’s physical properties to ensure a safe, functional, and efficient environment. This includes:

- Managing building operations and maintenance
- Planning space usage and layout

name: inadequate security, poor system design, poor HR policies) (OP:447) (SP)
definition: Factors that can weaken a business’s security or operations include inadequate security measures, poor system design, and ineffective human resource policies.

name: Discuss the nature of operational risk management (OP:448) (SP)
definition: The process of identifying, evaluating, and implementing measures to minimize or control potential risks that could disrupt business operations. This includes understanding the importance of risk assessment, risk control strategies, and how to manage risks effectively within an organization.

name: (PD:258) (SP)
definition: A skill or knowledge needed to demonstrate understanding or perform a task related to the performance indicator.

name: Explain the nature of corporate social responsibility (SM:082) (SP)
definition:
The concept that describes a company's duties to positively impact society and the environment through ethical practices and accountability.

- Supporting community initiatives

- Analyze environmental sustainability programs

definition:
Organizational change affects how a company develops and improves over time.  
- It can lead to improved efficiency and growth.  
- It may cause resistance or uncertainty among employees.  
- Successful change supports long-term organizational development.

name: Describe strategies and approaches for leading change (SM:088) (SP)

definition:
Using crowdsourcing in business involves seeking ideas, services, or solutions from a large group of people, often through online platforms. Examples include:

name: Describe product standards' issues associated with global business (QM:008) (SP)

name: Discuss the nature of global risk (RM:065) (SP)
definition: The nature of global risk refers to the understanding of potential threats or uncertainties that can impact international business and economies. These risks are influenced by factors such as political instability, economic changes, and natural disasters.

name: indicators, key process indicators) (RM:088) (SP)

name: Explain unfair labor practices (BL:119) (SP)
definition:
Unfair labor practices are actions by employers or employees that violate fair labor laws or interfere with workers' rights. These may include:
- Discriminating against employees for union activity

name: Comply with compensation and benefit laws (BL:120) (SP)

name: Repurpose content for social media (CO:210) (SP)

name: compensation and benefit programs, staff diversity, etc.) (HR:415) (SP)

A description of methods used by organizations to manage employee rewards and workplace diversity.

definition:
Understanding business and employment law, including:

name: etc.) (HR:426) (SP)

name: Assist with employee relocation (HR:434) (SP)
definition: Help with moving employees to new locations by organizing and supporting their relocation process.

definition:
The process of relocating employees to and from international assignments involves overcoming specific issues and following best practices.

name: Assess employee skills (HR:438) (SP)

name: Conduct gap and/or needs analysis to identify human-resources development needs (HR:443) (SP)

name: Assess company's learning needs (HR:440) (SP)

Develops and documents activities designed to improve employee skills and knowledge. These activities may include:

name: Facilitate employee learning (HR:531) (SP)

name: Evaluate learning (HR:532) (SP)

name: Explain labor-relations issues (HR:452) (SP)

The components of a total rewards system include the various ways an organization recognizes and compensates employees for their work. These components typically include:
